profiles.name: Octopus
clues: Found in coral reefs and ocean floor

profiles.name: Lion
clues: Known as the king of the jungle
Native to Africa and small parts of Asia
Roar can be heard 5 miles away
Cubs have spots that fade with age
Can run up to 50 mph for short distances
Featured in many myths and legends

profiles.name: Penguin
clues: Found in Antarctica and nearby regions
Mates for life in some species
Lays eggs on ice or land
Male Emperor penguins incubate eggs on feet
Slides on belly to move efficiently
Natural predators include seals and orcas

profiles.name: Elephant
clues: Trunk used for breathing and grasping
Lives in herds led by females
Symbol of wisdom in many cultures

profiles.name: Dolphin
clues: Can leap high out of water

profiles.name: Eagle
clues: Builds large nests in high places
Can spot prey from miles away
Found on every continent except Antarctica
Bald eagle is US national symbol
Has excellent eyesight for spotting prey

profiles.name: Tiger
clues: Each tiger has unique stripe pattern
Cubs stay with mother for 2 years
Roar can be heard 2 miles away

profiles.name: Giraffe
clues: Herbivore eating leaves from tall trees
Large heart to pump blood up neck
Neck has same number of vertebrae as humans

profiles.name: Wolf
clues: Largest wild member of dog family
Found in North America, Europe, Asia

profiles.name: Koala
clues: Can store leaves in cheek pouches

profiles.name: Shark
clues: Can detect blood from miles away

profiles.name: Chameleon
clues: Color changes for mood and temperature

profiles.name: Zebra
clues: Each zebra has unique stripe pattern

profiles.name: Cheetah
clues: Can reach speeds up to 120 km/h
Spotted coat with black teardrop marks

profiles.name: Rhinoceros
clues: Large herbivore with horn on nose

profiles.name: Hippopotamus
clues: Opens mouth wide as threat display

profiles.name: Snow Leopard
clues: Long tail for balance and warmth

profiles.name: Crocodile
clues: Fourth tooth visible when mouth closed

profiles.name: Peacock
clues: Native to India and Sri Lanka

profiles.name: Otter
clues: Thick layer of blubber in sea otters

profiles.name: Camel
clues: Wide feet for walking on sand
Native to Middle East and Asia

profiles.name: Toucan
clues: Native to Central and South America
Conservation concerns due to habitat loss

profiles.name: Arctic Fox
clues: Small ears to reduce heat loss

profiles.name: Bald Eagle
clues: Brown body with white head and tail
Distinctive white head develops at 4-5 years

profiles.name: Sea Turtle
clues: Return to birth beach to nest

profiles.name: Moose
clues: State animal of several US states

profiles.name: Flamingo
clues: Found in salt lakes and lagoons

profiles.name: Capybara
clues: Other animals often rest on them

profiles.name: Poison Dart Frog
clues: Native to Central and South America

profiles.name: Sloth
clues: Native to Central and South America

profiles.name: Porcupine
clues: Lifespan in captivity up to 15 years

profiles.name: Cassowary
clues: Native to Australia and New Guinea

profiles.name: Red Panda
clues: Mostly bamboo diet despite carnivore classification
False thumb helps grip bamboo stalks
Bushy tail for balance and warmth
Poor eyesight but excellent sense of smell
Can rotate hind legs backward for descending trees
Cute appearance makes popular in zoos

profiles.name: Meerkat
clues: Stands on hind legs to watch for predators
Lives in large family groups called mobs
Takes turns as sentinel watching for danger
Teaches young to hunt dead prey first
Babysitters care for young while others hunt

profiles.name: Hedgehog
clues: Spiny mammal curls into ball when threatened
Native to Europe, Asia, and Africa
Can run up to 6 miles per hour
Excellent sense of smell and hearing
Can survive falls due to spines
Symbol of cuteness in many cultures

profiles.name: Giant Squid
clues: Has largest eyes of any animal
Feeds on fish and smaller squid
Only known predator is sperm whale
Ancient mariners called them sea monsters

profiles.name: Bonobo
clues: Great ape from Democratic Republic Congo
Walk upright on two legs frequently

profiles.name: Wolverine
clues: Metabolic rate stays high in cold

profiles.name: Ring-tailed Lemur
clues: Distinctive black and white ringed tail

profiles.name: Emu
clues: Featured on Australian coat of arms

profiles.name: Dugong
clues: Females give birth to single calf

profiles.name: Capuchin Monkey
clues: Native to Central and South America

profiles.name: Kiwi
clues: Finds food by smell not sight
Egg very large relative to body

profiles.name: Proboscis Monkey
clues: Males have bigger noses than females

profiles.name: Hyena
clues: Strongest bite force of land mammals
